  • Changelog

    Implement probability averaging

    LOP.Rd

    Given a set of cumulative distribution functions (assume for now: defined on same values), combine using probability averaging (also called linear opinion pool). #TODO CITE This method calculates the (weighted) average of quantiles at a given value

    Usage

    LOP(
  quantile,
  value,
  id,
  ret_quantiles,
  ret_values,
  weight_fn = equal_weights,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    quantile

    vector containing quantiles for all cdfs to be aggregated

    value

    vector containing values for all cdfs to be aggregated

    id

    vector containing unique ids to distinguish cdf to be aggregated

    ret_quantiles

    vector of quantiles to return specifying the aggregate distribution

    ret_values

    vector of values to return specifying the aggregate distribution

    weight_fn

    function? specifying how to weight each model *FIX

    ...

    additional arguments

    Value

    vector of values for corresponding ret_quantiles of aggregate distribution

    Examples

    dat <- expand.grid(id = c("A", "B"),
                   quantile = seq(0,1,0.01))
dat$value <- ifelse(dat$id == "A", qnorm(dat$quantile), qnorm(dat$quantile, 0,2))
LOP(dat$quantile, dat$value, dat$id, seq(0,1,0.05), NA)
#> # A tibble: 21 × 2
#>    quantile    value
#>       <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1     0    -Inf    
#>  2     0.05  NaN    
#>  3     0.1    -1.90 
#>  4     0.15   -1.48 
#>  5     0.2    -1.17 
#>  6     0.25   -0.924
#>  7     0.3    -0.710
#>  8     0.35   -0.518
#>  9     0.4    -0.339
#> 10     0.45   -0.168
#> # ℹ 11 more rows
